review_blob: Enjoyed a pint earlier today @ the POV. Now up there with my fave golden ales. Was perfectly poured with the perfect amount of head, Citus & fruity taste. Golden ale at its best..quaffable!!!!
beer_name: Beer Geek Legend of the Golden Geek

review_blob: Its a regular on handpull at the Old Royal in Birmingham & is best described as a session ale (& I have had a few of those on this beer). Good froffy head, nice refreshing citrus taste & I generally get a well looked after pint! One of my safe favorites! Very nice in a bottle as well- Morrisons Supermarket if your wondering!

Just had a pint of this beer at Spoons for only 1.99 so not bad! Its my kind of beer- a strong blonde! Just a shame they served it a bit warm. Would have enjoyed this more if slightly colder! The beer has a floral aroma & quite a sweet after taste!
Sometime appears on handpull at the Canal Side Cafe. Very well kept here & an enjoyable beer! Not too pale in appearance & is more of a Golden Ale than say a Wye Valley HPA

Roaring Meg really is a knockout blonde! First tried a few weeks back in bottle form & then not long after on draught at Spoons.. Its very tasty, esepcially if you like your blondes! & also a bit of knockout on the strength front! Combine a few cold Roaring Megs with sunshine & it could just be perfect!
